alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 2:04AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM MDT THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following area, Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet/South Lincoln County. * WHEN...From 9 AM MDT this morning through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving thunderstorms are forecast to develop late Friday morning and continue through Friday night and early Saturday. Heavy rain is likely with these storms. Localized rainfall totals in excess of 3 inches are possible where training storms develop.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
